actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to deny an employer a deduction for group health plan expenses unless such plan includes first-dollar coverage for pediatric preventive health care.

summary.text: Child Health Incentives Reform Plan - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to deny employers an income tax deduction for group health plan expenses unless such plan includes first-dollar coverage for pediatric preventive health care with respect to any child under age 21. Defines "pediatric preventive health care" for purposes of qualification for such income tax deduction.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to deny an employer a deduction for group health plan expenses unless such plan includes first-dollar coverage for pediatric preventive health care.
